notes.text:
An update for libtiff is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
The libtiff packages contain a library of functions for manipulating Tagged Image File Format (TIFF) files.

Security Fix(es):

* libtiff: heap Buffer overflows in tiffcrop.c (CVE-2022-3570)

* libtiff: out-of-bounds write in _TIFFmemcpy in libtiff/tif_unix (CVE-2022-3597)

* libtiff: out-of-bounds write in extractContigSamplesShifted24bits in tools/tiffcrop.c (CVE-2022-3598)

* libtiff: out-of-bounds read in writeSingleSection in tools/tiffcrop.c (CVE-2022-3599)

* libtiff: out-of-bounds write in _TIFFmemset in libtiff/tif_unix.c (CVE-2022-3626)

* libtiff: out-of-bounds write in _TIFFmemcpy in libtiff/tif_unix.c (CVE-2022-3627)

* libtiff: integer overflow in function TIFFReadRGBATileExt of the file (CVE-2022-3970)

* libtiff: out-of-bounds read in tiffcp in tools/tiffcp.c (CVE-2022-4645)

* libtiff: heap buffer overflow issues related to TIFFTAG_INKNAMES and related TIFFTAG_NUMBEROFINKS value (CVE-2023-30774)

* libtiff: Heap buffer overflow in extractContigSamples32bits, tiffcrop.c (CVE-2023-30775)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

Additional Changes:

For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.2 Release Notes linked from the References section.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: A heap-based buffer overflow flaw was found in Libtiff's tiffcrop utility. This issue occurs during the conversion of a TIFF image file, allowing an attacker to pass a crafted TIFF image file to tiffcrop utility, which causes an out-of-bound access resulting an application crash, eventually leading to a denial of service.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: libtiff: heap Buffer overflows in tiffcrop.c
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

All running applications linked against libtiff must be restarted for this update to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: libtiff: heap Buffer overflows in tiffcrop.c

notes.text: An out-of-bounds write flaw was found in the _TIFFmemcpy function in libtiff/tif_unix.c in the libtiff package. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted TIFF image file, a remote attacker could cause a denial of service condition.

notes.text: An integer overflow flaw was found in LibTIFF. This issue exists in the TIFFReadRGBATileExt function of the libtiff/tif_getimage.c file, and may lead to a buffer overflow.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: libtiff: integer overflow in function TIFFReadRGBATileExt of the file
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Red Hat Product security rated this issue having Moderate security impact as the exploitation of this issue will most likely to cause a denial of service attack. The score is based on the worst case scenario that an attacker might use the integer overflow to trigger other vulnerabilities such as buffer overflow, that could result in more adverse effects.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

All running applications linked against libtiff must be restarted for this update to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: libtiff: integer overflow in function TIFFReadRGBATileExt of the file

notes.text: A flaw was found in tiffcp, a program distributed by the libtiff package. A specially crafted tiff file can lead to an out-of-bounds read in the tiffcp function in tools/tiffcp.c, resulting in a denial of service and limited information disclosure.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: libtiff: out-of-bounds read in tiffcp in tools/tiffcp.c
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: libtiff is a general purpose library to manipulate TIFF images. The library itself is not used directly, it's used via another application linked with the library, which means this issue can only be triggered by an application processing untrusted images. Therefore, if there is no way an attacker can provide a crafted image to an application, it's likely not possible to exploit this CVE.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

All running applications linked against libtiff must be restarted for this update to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: libtiff: out-of-bounds read in tiffcp in tools/tiffcp.c

cwe.name: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer

notes.text: A vulnerability was found in the libtiff library. This flaw causes a buffer overflow in libtiff that allows a local attacker to cause a denial of service via the tiffcp function in tiffcp.c.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: libtiff: Heap buffer overflow in tiffcp() at tiffcp.c
notes.title: Vulnerability summary
